page.title: 06Events in Swindon 1985
page.content: In May the Tory party suffered a major defeat in the local elections.The Liberal-SDP Alliance had broken their hold on the Wiltshire County Council for the first time. It is seen as a comment on the Tory Government's mid-term unpopularity, over interference with local government and unemployment policies. { Schools in the town have been disrupted again this year as teachers hold strikes and withdraw goodwill because of their falling salaries. { Work will start on two new murals this summer,sponsored by Arkell's brewery. These will enhance th other murals found throughout the town depicting much of the town's history and its famous people.
